text: The Bolivarian Games are a multinational sporting event which began in 1938. It has featured baseball 14 times, most recently in 2017.Bolivarian Games ==Results== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%; width:65%; text-align: center;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:5%;"|Year ! rowspan="2" style="width:10%;"|Final Host | rowspan="50" style="width:1%; border-top:none; border-bottom:none;"| !colspan=5|Medalists |- !width=17%|Gold ! colspan="2" style="width:17%;"|Silver ! colspan="2" style="width:17%;"|Bronze |- | | Bogota |'''''' |colspan=2| | |- style="background: #D0E6FF;" | | Lima |'''''' |colspan=2| |colspan=2| |- | | Caracas |'''''' |colspan=2| |colspan=2| |- style="background: #D0E6FF;" | | Barranquilla |'''''' |colspan=2| |colspan=2| |- | | Guayaquil |'''''' |colspan=2| |colspan=2| |- style="background: #D0E6FF;" | | Maracaibo |'''''' |colspan=2| |colspan=2| |- | | Panama City |'''''' |colspan=2| |colspan=2| |- style="background: #D0E6FF;" | | Barquisimeto |'''''' |colspan=2| |colspan=2| |- | | Ecuador |'''''' |colspan=2| |colspan=2| |- style="background: #D0E6FF;" | | Maracaibo |'''''' |colspan=2| |colspan=2| |- | | Guayaquil |'''''' |colspan=2| |colspan=2| |- style="background: #D0E6FF;" | | Sucre |'''''' |colspan=2| |colspan=2| |- | Details | Trujillo |'''''' |colspan=2| |colspan=2| |- style="background: #D0E6FF;" | | Santa Marta |'''''' |colspan=2| |colspan=2| |} ==Medal table== ==References== Bolivarian Bolivarian Games Bolivarian Games Category:Baseball in the Caribbean
